Name: AP Physics 1 Essentials: An APlusPhysics Guide

ReviewList.Text: My Sons HS class had no book.  This solved that problem and follows the curriculum perfectly.  Now he doesn't have to rely on the teacher providing a good lecture.  He has a reference to use.
This is a great for developing a curriculum guide. Great book for our classroom library and resource for our students.

After graduating from engineering school and working in the industry for a number of years, I'm interesting seeing how new textbooks present physics concepts to see if I would have benefited from their teaching approach.  I feel the methods presented in this book would have better helped me in my time as a student.  I always learned the best in deconstructing the example problems.  In this book you have a huge number of problems to learn from.  I'd give this book my thumbs up.

Great starting book or review book to learn the essentials of physics. Why spend hours in a textbook,  trying to figure out concepts that you did not understand in class, when you can spend less time reading and more time learning the essentials of physics in AP Physics Essentials I. Dan Fullerton has done a great job presenting the material and providing multiple answered problems with explanations to help the learning process.
Provides a good outline of the subject matter.  Looks like a great starting point for developing a curriculum.  Glad i purchased it.

I am a high school AP Physics teacher and use this book every day.  It is a great starting point for the basic understanding needed for students to be able to answer the conceptual questions that wil be asked on the new exam.

This looks like a great "1st start" book.  The author is very humble in saying that the book is a good reflection of the the new syllabus but that it will need to be revised after the 1st test if offered in May 2015.
Excellent book for getting started! Unique approaches to a potentially intimidating subject. Great examples of how to break down contents so that students are successful.
I found this book to be quite enjoyable given my lack of enjoyment in the actual subject matter. I learn well from examples and the examples cited in this book were on point and extremely helpful.

One of the few books out there for the brand-new A.P. Physics 1 (and A.P. Physics 2) courses that have replaced the "inch deep and mile wide" A.P. Physics B.  Nice worked examples, practice exercises with answers, and both qualitative and quantitative exercises for students to work.  The artwork is perhaps a bit more juvenile and cartoonish than I'd like, but a well done piece of work.
served as good reference for my kid

Starting in September 2014, high schools across our country will offer the new AP Physics 1 curriculum, replacing AP Physics "B". Dan Fullerton's book gives teachers and students a coherent, head start on mastering this material.
Excellent book for ap physics
item as desbrid. thank you
fast and accurate
my son says that it is used frequently during class.  hopefully it will bring him to a high score for his AP exam
Great product
Great review

This book is well-written and easy to understand. The real-world examples clearly illustrate the concepts. It makes you think about simple things like drills and merry-go-rounds in a whole new light. I would highly recommend this book to any student taking AP Physics (or anyone needing a quick refresher!). I also find the quotes at the beginning of each chapter highly amusing (especially Chapter 12). A laugh when studying physics is always a good thing!
Great book! Clear explanations and great questions.
My daughter said it helped her very much.
physics is cray

The author should be ashamed of himself and this should be pulled of the shelves immediately.  This book came out well before the true nature of the AP1 questions was known and is no way representative of AP physics 1 questions.  A great deal of the questions are simply reprints of questions from the NYS regents physics exam (which is free online), and is entry level physics questions not even APB physics caliber.  The other questions are simply not representative of this exam.  I am an AP teacher and have viewed the actual new exam questions and they are worlds way from this book.  If you bought it, return it or use it as kindling.

This book is organized in a very strange way: every problem is followed directly by its answer. When you look at the problems, you will see the answers at the same time. Mr. Fullerton, are you really a high school teacher?  Is this the way that you teach?
It's too easy for AP Physics 1...!!!!
If you need lots of mathematical practice problems this is the book for you.  If you need conceptual help then use the 5 steps AP physics 1 review book.
was hoping the book would explain how to do the problems, on the plus side lots of examples, and slightly entertaining way of explaining physics
sons book
